pages.title: Basic structural and functional unit of life is?
Some nucleotides
Which of the following statements regarding microscopes is correct?
choices: In a light microscope, visible light is passed through the objective lens and then through the specimen.
Projection of a light beam through a vacuum is the principle of an electron microscope.
Scanning electron microscope is used to study the internal structure of cells.
Transmission electron microscope is used for detail studies of living specimens.
Magnification and resolution power are important properties of all microscopes.
pages.correctAnswer: Magnification and resolution power are important properties of all microscopes.

pages.title: In the cytoskeleton,
choices: microtubules are involved in the movement of organelles.
microfilaments are involved in the movement of chromosomes during cell division.
intermediate filaments provide channels to secrete materials from the cell.
pages.correctAnswer: intermediate filaments provide channels to secrete materials from the cell.

pages.title: In the cell cycle,
choices: DNA synthesis takes place during G1 phase.
protein synthesis occurs during G2 phase.
formation of spindle begins during metaphase.
condensation of chromatin fibres takes place during S phase.
division of the cytoplasm occurs during anaphase.
pages.correctAnswer: division of the cytoplasm occurs during anaphase.

pages.title: Which of the following statements regarding chlorophyll is correct?
choices: Chlorophyll absorbs violet, blue and red light.
Chlorophyll-b is the main light capturing pigment in plants.
Chlorophyll-a is most efficient for capturing green light.
Chlorophyll-a is involved in absorption and dissipation of excessive light energy.
In photosystem-I, chlorophyll-a absorbs light at 680 nm wavelength.
pages.correctAnswer: In photosystem-I, chlorophyll-a absorbs light at 680 nm wavelength.

pages.title: A compound formed during ethyl alcohol fermentation, lactic acid fermentation and aerobic respiration is
During the evolution of organisms, coelom was first developed in
Which of the following structures can be seen in annelids as well as in arthropods?
Which of the following plants is evolutionarily closest to Marchantial
In dicotyledonous plants
choices: stamens produce megaspores that develop into pollen grains.
vascular bundles in the stem are scattered.
pages.correctAnswer: vascular bundles in the stem are scattered.

pages.title: Which of the following statements regarding the epidermis of plants is correct?
choices: It usually consists of several layers of cells.
Root hairs are multicellular projections of epidermal cells.
Deposition of suberin in epidermal cells prevents water loss.
pages.correctAnswer: Deposition of suberin in epidermal cells prevents water loss.

pages.title: Select the correct statement regarding the adaptations of plants for efficient photosynthesis.
choices: Plants are branched in a pattern that is suitable to absorb the maximum amount of carbon dioxide from atmosphere.
Large leaves are present in plants growing in dry environments to maximize light capture.
Leaves of some plants are arranged almost vertically to get the maximum amount of light.
Leaves of some plants are arranged horizontally to avoid damage by over intense light.
Plants grow tall to avoid shading by neighbouring plants.
pages.correctAnswer: Plants grow tall to avoid shading by neighbouring plants.

pages.title: During the opening of stomata
choices: sodium ions are actively transported into guard cells.
turgor pressure of guard cells reduces.
carbon dioxide content in the substomatal cavity increases.
water potential in guard cells decreases.
potassium ions are passively transported into guard cells.
pages.correctAnswer: potassium ions are passively transported into guard cells.

pages.title: Select the correct statement regarding nutritional requirements of plants.
choices: Iron is a macronutrient required by plants.
Deficiency of sulphur can be identified by chlorosis of older leaves.
Magnesium is a component of carotenoids.
Deficiency of nitrogen causes chlorosis mainly in young leaves.
Molybdenum is required for nitrogen metabolism.
pages.correctAnswer: Molybdenum is required for nitrogen metabolism.

pages.title: A feature seen in the sexual reproduction of all land plants is
choices: non-requirement of external water for fertilization.
production of two types of spores.

pages.title: Which of the following statements regarding the responses of plants to light is correct?
choices: There are two major classes of photoreceptors in plants.
Blue light photoreceptors regulate seed germination.
Exposure to direct sunlight stimulates vertical growth.
Green and red are the most important colours of light for regulating photomorphogenesis.
Positive phototropism occurs due to faster elongation of cells in the brighter side of the shoot.
pages.correctAnswer: Positive phototropism occurs due to faster elongation of cells in the brighter side of the shoot.

 Type of feeders Example
Which of the following statements regarding the digestion of nucleic acids in food in man is correct?
choices: DNA is broken down to nucleotides by nucleotidase.
Nucleosidase is involved in the digestion of nitrogenous bases.
RNA is broken down to nucleotides by pancreatic nuclease.
Intestinal nucleotidase acts on nitrogenous bases.
pages.correctAnswer: Intestinal nucleotidase acts on nitrogenous bases.

pages.title: Which of the following may be a consequence of hypotension?
The cells that mediate internal defences in innate immunity in man are
choices: natural killer cells and T cells.

Which of the following is the correct pathway of light and nerve impulses for the vision of humans?
choices: cornea -> aqueous humour ->lens -> vitreous humour -> photoreceptors -> ganglion cells —> bipolar cells -> optic nerve -> occipital lobe of cerebrum
cornea —» aqueous humour —* lens —* vitreous humour —»> photoreceptors —» ganglion cells —» bipolar cells —* optic nerve temporal lobe of cerebrum
cornea -» aqueous humour -»lens -» vitreous humour —» photoreceptors -» bipolar cells -* ganglion cells -* optic nerve —* occipital lobe of cerebrum
cornea -» vitreous humour -> lens -» aqueous humour photoreceptors —» bipolar cells -* ganglion cells-Coptic nerve-» occipital lobe of cerebrum
cornea -*• vitreous humour -*lens aqueous humour -> photoreceptors -» bipolar cells -» ganglion cells—» optic nerve —* temporal lobe of cerebrum
pages.correctAnswer: cornea -*• vitreous humour -*lens aqueous humour -> photoreceptors -» bipolar cells -» ganglion cells—» optic nerve —* temporal lobe of cerebrum

pages.title: In which of the following responses, the hormone and its main function are correctly matched?
choices: Parathyroid hormone - Lowering blood calcium level
pages.correctAnswer: Parathyroid hormone - Lowering blood calcium level

Select the correct statement regarding human skeletal system.
choices: Elbow joint formed by humerus, radius and ulna permits only flexion and extension of the fore arm.
Hinge joint formed by femur, fibula and patella permits standing upright for a long time.
Arches of the foot are important in distributing body weight only while standing.
Secondary curvatures in the thoracic and sacral regions of the vertebral column help to maintain erect posture.
A non-inflammatory degenerative disease called osteoporosis causes pain and restricted movement in the affected joints.
pages.correctAnswer: A non-inflammatory degenerative disease called osteoporosis causes pain and restricted movement in the affected joints.

pages.title: In man, sickle cell anaemia is an example for
Which of the following statements regarding the cross Rr x Rr is correct?
choices: The probability of having the allele r in both the egg and sperm at fertilization is 1/2
This is a dihybrid cross because two alleles are involved.
According to Mendelian inheritance, the probability of having dominant phenotype in F2 generation by interbreeding of F1, is 9/16
If 1:2:1 ratio of phenotypes was obtained in F2 generation by interbreeding of F1, generation, it may be due to codominance.

pages.title: During the gametogenesis of a particular person, a gamete with 24 chromosomes was produced. This gamete was fertilized with a normal gamete and a child was born. Which of the following best explains this process and its result?

During replication of DNA, a cytosine molecule had been added instead of a thymine molecule in a gene. This mutated gene produced a peptide with the same amino acid sequence as the gene before mutation. This is an example for
DNA polymerase obtained from thermophilic bacteria is used for PCR because
choices: they contain more DNA polymerase than other organisms.
that DNA polymerase does not have proofreading ability.
that DNA polymerase is stable at high temperatures required for separation of DNA strands in the laboratory.
it is the only DNA polymerase which can copy DNA in the laboratory.
that DNA polymerase does not need a primer to initiate DNA synthesis.
pages.correctAnswer: that DNA polymerase does not need a primer to initiate DNA synthesis.

pages.title: A DNA fragment can be inserted in to a plasmid vector if that fragment has
choices: a nucleotide sequence identical to that of the vector.
been cut by the same restriction enzyme which had been used to cut the vector.
originated from the same cell type as of the vector.
the same length as that of the vector.
at least one origin of replication (Ori).
pages.correctAnswer: at least one origin of replication (Ori).

pages.title: Dry patana grasslands in Sri Lanka are found in
Which of the following is not an environmental service value of biodiversity?
Which of the following does not contribute to global warming?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding the culture media used to grow microbes in the laboratory?
choices: Agar in culture media provides the suitable pH range for the growth of microorganisms.
Glucose is generally used to prepare culture media to grow fungi.
Culture media for bacteria are prepared using potatoes.
Any microorganism can be cultured in a culture medium.
Sodium chloride is usually added to all culture media.
pages.correctAnswer: Sodium chloride is usually added to all culture media.

Which of the following statements regarding energy relations in organisms is/are correct?
choices: (A) In cellular respiration, photophosphorylation and oxidative phosphorylation occur.
(B) During metabolic reactions, ATP oxidises to ADP.
(C) Energy stored in ATP can be converted to electrical energy.
(D) Substrate phosphorylation occurs in Krebs cycle.

pages.title: Which of the following classes includes/include animals having internal fertilization as well as those having external fertilization?
Select the correct statement/statements regarding the respiratory pigments of animals.
choices: Myoglobin is present in bony fishes.

pages.title: Smoking
choices: stimulates the secretion of mucus by goblet cells in the respiratory tract.
decreases the oxygen transport in blood.
inhibits the action of cilia in the respiratory tract.

pages.title: Which of the following contributes/contribute for the maintenance of resting potential of a neuron?
choices: Unequal distribution of Na+, K+, Cl- and large anions inside and outside the neuron
Active transport of Na+ out of the neuron and K+ in to the neuron in 3:2 ratio
Opening of more K+ channels than Na+ channels in the neuron membrane
Transport of more Na+ in to the intracellular fluid of the neuron than K+
Transport of Cl” from the neuron to the extracellular fluid
pages.correctAnswer: Transport of Cl” from the neuron to the extracellular fluid

pages.title: Parthenogenesis
choices: produces a complete individual from an unfertilized egg.
can be observed in some lizards.
can be seen in all invertebrates.
pages.correctAnswer: can be seen in all invertebrates.

In which of the following responses, the biomes that are encountered when traveling from the north pole towards equator are given in correct sequence?
choices: Tundra, coniferous forests, temperate grasslands, deserts, tropical forests
Tundra, coniferous forests, temperate broad-leaf forests, chaparral, deserts
Tundra, temperate grasslands, coniferous forests, deserts, tropical forests
Tundra, temperate broad-leaf forests, coniferous forests, tropical forests, deserts
Tundra, coniferous forests, chaparral, temperate grasslands, savanna
pages.correctAnswer: Tundra, coniferous forests, chaparral, temperate grasslands, savanna

Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding spoilage of food?
choices: Saccharolytic microorganisms are responsible for rancidity of food.
Putrefaction occurs mainly due to breakdown of proteins.
Lipolytic microorganisms are responsible for fermentation of food.
Rancidity occurs due to generation of amines
pages.correctAnswer: Rancidity occurs due to generation of amines
